channel.title: Need some serious help making my server
channel.description:
Hello Moparscape forums. This is my first of many posts ; ). Im having some trouble setting up a server. I followed all of the guides on the site. I have all my ports fowarded, my enviormental variables set, and a no-ip Server and The DUC. I need some1 to recomend me a source. And im having some issues with the source. Like Every time I compile I get an error saying It can not find the path specified. And even when i replace it with what the guides tell me to replace what is inside the file with, I still get errors. I also am wondering, How do I get it so when i start the server base, It starts MY server, not the one pre loaded into the base. All help is appreciated. Thanks
-kookajamo.

item.title: Need some serious help making my server
item.dc:creator: @kookajamo kookajamo
item.description:
@kookajamo wrote:

Ok thanks. It said timed out. So I am fowarding the port again using a guide. I will post back after I have finished if it works or not.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 26, 2009, 01:33:32 pm[/size][hr]Ugh. I followed a port fowarding guide. and it still isnt open. Any ideas how to open it?

Read full topic
item.source: Need some serious help making my server

item.title: Need some serious help making my server
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Ok, go to canyouseeme.org and type the port your server is running on in the box, and if it says connection timed out, you haven’t portforwarded correctly.

Read full topic
item.source: Need some serious help making my server

item.title: Need some serious help making my server
item.dc:creator: @kookajamo kookajamo
item.description:
@kookajamo wrote:

I got it all running and I can log in. But when my friend tries to he gets “error connecting to server” whats wrong?

Read full topic
item.source: Need some serious help making my server

item.title: Need some serious help making my server
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

hey can use the mopar if they want. But if you have custom items in your server, They will need to use your client.

Read full topic
item.source: Need some serious help making my server

item.title: Need some serious help making my server
item.dc:creator: @kookajamo kookajamo
item.description:
@kookajamo wrote:

Tysm zyle. Now do they need to be using the same client as me? Or can they use like the moparscape client?

Read full topic
item.source: Need some serious help making my server

item.title: Need some serious help making my server
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Ya, tell the to type in your No-IP address into their client, and they should be able to connect if you did everything correctly.

Read full topic
item.source: Need some serious help making my server

item.title: Need some serious help making my server
item.dc:creator: @kookajamo kookajamo
item.description:
@kookajamo wrote:

So if I just do run.bat in my base and then log onto the client as 127.0.0.1 I will be on my server and then people can connect to it by putting in my No-IP address?

Read full topic
item.source: Need some serious help making my server

item.title: Need some serious help making my server
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Just clieck run.bat in your server, start the client, in the client, put the IP as 127.0.0.1 and then login.

Read full topic
item.source: Need some serious help making my server

item.title: Need some serious help making my server
item.dc:creator: @kookajamo kookajamo
item.description:
@kookajamo wrote:

Ok. And so how do I like add my server IP from No-ip into the base? So when i click start server.bat it loads my server. Not the one already in the base?

Read full topic
item.source: Need some serious help making my server

item.title: Need some serious help making my server
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Download a client, and a server. I suggest, for wL bases, Project 16. Client, I would suggest a blank 317 deob.

Read full topic
